name: Wanko de Kururin! Wankuru
description:
Wankuru is a falling-block puzzle game that plays similarly to Sega's Baku Baku Animal. Players drop pairs of puzzle blocks, which can be dogs, doghouses, or a mix of the two. The goal is to place long chains of dogs of the same colour, then place a doghouse of the same colour next to them so the whole chain can go home. Like other puzzle games, creating long chain reactions produces a major point reward. Like in the Puyo Puyo series, chain reactions rain garbage blocks down on the opponent's playfield; in this game, the garbage blocks are bones, and any dog eating a bone will refuse to enter a doghouse until they finish.

Similar to the earlier Windows version, there are both single-player and multiplayer modes. The main single-player game is a story mode which features some short visual novel-style scenes in between matches against the CPU. In this version the player is able to customize both their protagonist and their dog. The player can pick and name a female or male protagonist, and can also choose from one of a large number of dog breeds to name and customize. There is also a score attack mode, in which the player tries to get as far as possible through a set of 100 levels while racking up points. There is also a two-player mode which uses the Game Boy Advance's link cable.

shot.caption: Title screen
When playing for the first time, the player goes through a mandatory tutorial.
The fairy walks us through the basic game mechanics - here, connecting dogs with houses.
Let's go - wankuru!
The player can rotate and drop pairs of dogs, houses, or a mix of the two.
Dogs will enter any house of the matching colour.
This tutorial encourages us to build chains of multiple colours.
Two chain!
The next tutorial introduces us to building larger houses. We can combine houses of the same colour in order to get more points; this works like Puzzle Fighter.
The pause screen lets us choose whether or not to continue.
The pause screen dog is disappointed if we choose not to continue. :(
Main menu; this lets us choose from the different game modes. This includes the single-player puzzle mode, story mode, link cable mode, and the option to replay tutorials.
The story mode lets us choose between a male or female protagonist, unlike the Windows version.
We can name our character; it includes an English font!
The story scene introduces us to our peaceful town...
There are so many dog lovers here!
I'm so happy we're going to the dog park.
The protagonist we didn't pick becomes a character in the story.
We get to pick a dog from one of a large number of breeds. We also get multiple fur pattern colours for each breed, too.
We also get to name our dog.
The story scenes include dialogue with multiple characters.
Our first story mode match; here, we're playing against the fairy from the tutorial. The big playfield is ours and the small playfield is the opponent.
Waiting for the link cable to respond...
